jobTitle: MBA Intern - Product Marketing Manager - Integrated Systems Business Unit
jobDescription: Intern Product Marketing Manager Intern - Integrated Business Unit Location: Palo Alto, CA, Summer 2018  VMware is a global leader in cloud infrastructure and business mobility. VMware accelerates customers digital transformation journey by enabling enterprises to master a software-defined approach to business and IT. With VMware solutions, organizations are creating exceptional experiences by mobilizing everything, responding faster to opportunities with modern data and apps hosted across hybrid clouds, and safeguarding customer trust with a defense-in-depth approach to cybersecurity.  At the core of what we do are our people who deeply value execution, passion, integrity, customers, and community. Do you dare to do the stuff youve always dreamed about? Dare to explore at http://careers.vmware.com. Team Description The mission of the Integrated Systems Business Unit (ISBU) is to bring the Software Defined Data Center (SDDC) to the mainstream by delivering integrated offerings that are simple for pur customers to purchase, deploy, and operate. In other words, we focus on delivering experiences to customers that make it easy for them to build their IT environments with VMware products so that they can focus on their business goals. We work with all the business units across VMware to ensure that the integrated offerings are built to VMware standard methodologies and incorporate the latest features.  The two main solutions that we are responsible for are the VMware Validated Designs and VMware Cloud Foundation. The VMware Validated Designs provides comprehensive and extensively tested blueprints for customers to build and operate the VMware SDDC stack. VMware Cloud Foundation takes this a step further and automates the deployment and operations of the VMware SDDC stack. Both offerings are fundamental to VMwares cloud strategy to help its customers in their digital transformations.  Product Marketing Managers are business owners who are responsible for driving the go-to-market initiatives for a product. Successful PMMs will lead cross-functional teams to successfully meet their objectives. This leadership requires setting the overall vision for product go-to-market strategy, knowing and monitoring key performance indicators, understanding the dynamics of both direct and channel sales, and influencing many teams towards common goals. Specific responsibilities include:Develop a deep understanding of the private and public cloud markets. Identify customer goals, challenges, buying behaviors and sales motions. Define target markets and corresponding go-to-market strategies.Define the sales and channel strategy. Analyze the sales cycle and channel mix, and formulate ideas and approaches to optimize the selling process.Drive the overall marketing strategy.
